articles.author: MPX
articles.title: WaPo: Trump made 1,419 in 7 weeks leading up to midterms
articles.description: The Washington Post Fact Checker is reporting that "in the seven weeks leading up the midterm elections, the President made 1,419 false or misleading claims, an average of 30 a day."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: GOP to target pre-existing conditions, safety nets if they retain House
articles.description: According to the New York Times, “Republicans would claim a conservative mandate to cut taxes, chip away at the Affordable Care Act and shrink federal spending” if they retain the House of Representatives in the midterms.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: 2018 Early voting ballots exceed 2014 count
articles.description: According to the NBC News Data Analytics Lab -- using voter data provided by Target Smart --  roughly 29 million Americans have already voted. That number exceeds the total early vote in the 2014 midterm election by more than 8 million.

articles.title: Politico: GOP fears Trump’s immigration obsession could backfire

articles.title: Candidates fighting for key Southern California House seat

articles.title: What is Beto O’Rourke’s closing message?
articles.description: The Texas Senate race looks like it is tightening as Beto O’Rourke tries to unseat Ted Cruz. MSNBC’s Garrett Haake joins Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle to discuss O’Rourke’s messaging five days before the midterms.

articles.title: How Georgia could change history after the midterms
articles.description: Watch Stephanie Ruhle and Ali Velshi hone in on a states that could change history this election – Georgia. NBC’s Catie Beck joins the conversation to break down how voters feel about the potential first black female governor.

articles.title: Top White House official blasts minimum...

articles.title: Trump does himself no favors with response to synagogue massacre

articles.content: On Saturday, a gunman opened fire in a Pittsburgh synagogue, massacring 11 people. The shooter said he was motivated by his belief in a conspiracy theory: a Jewish financier, the gunman said, is paying for an invasion of Central American migrants seeking refu… [+2428 chars]

articles.title: 'If you vote against health care, I vote against you.'
